meanings.definition: To defeat again or overcome after a previous defeat.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, the team worked hard to redefeat their opponents in the rematch.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was determined to redefeat his rival in the upcoming match.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's plan to redefeat the villain involved a clever disguise.
meanings.sent4: The student's study habits were redefeating his chances of passing the exam.
meanings.sent5: The idea of redefeating the unbeatable record inspired the athlete to train harder.

meanings.definition: The act of causing someone or something to be defeated again.
meanings.sent1: The redefeating of the champion surprised everyone at the tournament.
meanings.sent2: The coach's strategy led to the redefeating of the previously unbeatable team.
meanings.sent3: The redefeating of the puzzle challenge brought a sense of accomplishment to the group.
meanings.sent4: The redefeating of the virus required a new approach to medical research.
meanings.sent5: The redefeating of the rival gang secured the neighborhood's safety.
